Header.title: Learning React
Header.paragraph: Want to learn React? We've got you. Here are resources you can use.

About.paragraph: React was created in 2013 by Meta (formerly Facebook). It's a library that people use to build interaces and add interactive functionality to a website using JavaScript. It's used by many famous companies and has become the default front end standard. If you don't know how to use it, now's a great time to learn.

Services.name: React.dev
Services.text: The sleek new docs can be seen at React.dev, our top recommendation.

Services.name: Legacy Docs
Services.text: The legacy react docs are at legacy.react.org. Warning: they aren't updated.

Services.name: FreeCodeCamp
Services.text: FreeCodeCamp, at freecodecamp.org, is a nonprofit with a number of good React tutorials.

Services.name: JavaScriptPage
Services.text: JavaScriptPage.com has a number of quality tutorials about React.

Services.name: w3schools.com
Services.text: W3Schools has some great React learning materials.

Services.name: Mozilla Developer
Services.text: Developer.mozilla.org is a gold standard for dev content, and has a React guide.

Testimonials.text: "React lets you build user interfaces out of individual pieces called components."
Testimonials.name: Johnathan Doe

Testimonials.text: "React components receive data and return what should appear on the screen."
Testimonials.name: John Doe

Testimonials.text: "React components are JavaScript functions. Learning React is learning programming."
Testimonials.name: Johnathan Doe

Testimonials.text: "If you're interested in playing around with React, you can use an online code playground, such as CodePen."
Testimonials.name: Johnathan Doe

Testimonials.text: "You can use as little or as much React as you need."
Testimonials.name: John Doe

Testimonials.text: "You can add React to an HTML page in one minute, just to experiment."
Testimonials.name: John Doe

Features.title: Declarative
Features.text: React's declarative approach simplifies UI development by specifying how the UI should look.

Features.title: Component-Based
Features.text: React endorses the creation of reuseable components, which can be composed into complex UIs.

Features.title: Virtual DOM
Features.text: React uses a virtual DOM to efficiently update only the parts of your page that have changed.

Features.title: Ecosystem
Features.text: React has an enormous and vibrant ecosystem, possibly the largest one in all of open source.
